statement.text: Corporate investment decisions apply NPV and related tools to evaluate major expenditures such as capacity expansion, new facilities, technology upgrades, and strategic initiatives. These decisions follow a structured process from proposal to post-implementation review.

explanation.intuition: When a company considers building a new factory or launching a product line, it's essentially asking: 'Will this investment create value for shareholders?' NPV provides the framework to answer this question systematically, comparing the value of expected benefits to the cost of the investment.
explanation.key_insight: Corporate investment decisions are the primary way firms allocate capital and shape their future. The quality of these decisions directly impacts shareholder value, competitive position, and long-term survival. That's why large companies have formal capital budgeting processes with multiple levels of review.
explanation.technical_details: A typical corporate investment decision process: (1) Proposal generation - business units identify opportunities, (2) Initial screening - rough NPV, strategic fit check, (3) Detailed analysis - rigorous cash flow forecasting, risk assessment, (4) Approval process - investment committee review, (5) Implementation - execution and monitoring, (6) Post-audit - actual vs. projected performance.

capacity_expansion.description: Adding production capacity to meet demand
capacity_expansion.typical_analysis: Multi-year cash flow projection with sensitivity on volume and margins

technology_upgrade.description: Replacing or upgrading equipment and systems
technology_upgrade.typical_analysis: Incremental NPV comparing new vs. keeping existing equipment

new_market_entry.description: Entering new geographic or product markets
new_market_entry.typical_analysis: Scenario analysis with option value for expansion or exit

rd_investment.typical_analysis: Real options or decision tree with probability-weighted NPV

best_practices: Use multiple criteria (NPV, IRR, payback) for different stakeholder perspectives
Perform sensitivity analysis on key assumptions
Consider strategic value beyond financial returns
Use project-specific discount rates for different risk levels
Conduct post-implementation audits to improve future forecasts

definitions_glossary.investment_committee: Senior management group that approves major capital expenditures
definitions_glossary.hurdle_rate: Minimum required return for project approval
definitions_glossary.post_audit: Review comparing actual results to projections after implementation
